hen the delete permission is selected in a muting permission set, the Modify All Records permission is automatically muted as well.

This is because the Delete permission implies the ability to modify records by deleting them. Therefore, to prevent users with the muting permission set from accidentally or intentionally modifying records, the Modify All Records permission is also muted.

View All Records and View All Data permissions are not affected by the muting of the Delete permission, as they are not related to record modification.

questions.question_text: Which two results can be expected if an administrator uses Data Loader to transfer ownership of account records? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Correct answer- C and D

A. All account teams are removed from the records that are transferred.
D. All ownership-based sharing rules for the records are recalculated.

Option A is correct, because when a record is transferred to a new owner, the account teams associated with the record are also removed. This is because account teams are based on the account owner, and when the owner changes, the team membership is no longer relevant.Option D is also correct, because when a record's ownership changes, the ownership-based sharing rules for the record are automatically recalculated to determine which users or groups should have access to the record based on the new owner's role, role hierarchy, and other sharing settings.
